availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Duncan (Garrard County, Kentucky, medical doctor)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Logan McKee in Garrard County on June 17, 1841. Father of Pattie Duncan, John Duncan, Margaret Duncan, Charlotte Duncan, William Duncan, Ben Duncan, James Duncan, Jane Duncan, Samuel Duncan, and Kellie Duncan. Physician in Garrard County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. Medical doctor in Garrard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 1, p. 263A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 18.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 73.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 1, p. 79.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Garrard County Marriages, Film #000183256, p. 272.
North America, Family Histories, 1500-2000, Lineage Book: National Society Daughters of the American Revolution, Vol. 118 (1915), p. 145.
